title: [Placements] Do companies only expect software development skills from CS students during placements?
content:
Hi everyone,

Today, I attended the Pre-Placement Talk of Goldman Sachs, and they mentioned that they are hiring for the SDE (Software Development Engineer) role for the upcoming Summer Internship. I’ve also noticed that several other companies are offering similar SDE roles.

This has left me wondering —
Do companies only expect software development skills from CS students?

What if someone is more interested in Data Science, Data Analytics, or other non-SDE roles? Do these companies even consider such profiles seriously during on-campus placements?

Do Tier 1 and Tier 2 companies ever hire for Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or related roles directly through campus placements?

I'm genuinely confused about whether I should continue building skills in data related field or shift focus toward SDE preparation just because that’s what most companies seem to be offering.

It would be really helpful if some seniors could share their experiences or guide us on how to navigate this situation.

Thanks in advance!

comments.body: Some companies come for Data Analyst, Data Science roles as well but the majority of companies come for SDE or related roles. There are some companies that come for non-tech roles as well

Most of them come for SDE or SDE intern , since your a fresher they dont expect much stuff specifically. Almost all of them expect DSA, dbms, cn and os. Some of them also have web dev requirements. 

That doesn't mean companies dont come for data science roles. I believe meesho had come for 50+ LPA data scientist role. 
Look at JDs attached with the emails u receive.
You will get a good idea of what role the company is looking for.
Should I believe that 1 in 10 companies come for data roles??

You should read the FAQs, I answered this previously in an older comment. But to summarise - companies will hire under a generic SWE/SDE role and then assign teams based on fit later. Sometimes you get lucky if your profile shows an alignment with what they are looking for (condition to vacancies in hiring teams). But mostly, companies do \*not\* directly look for specialised roles because quite simply, they do not expect such specialisations. 

For more details, look up my older comment.
Can you give some idea of percentage like x% of company do visits for data science role and will they offer summer internship??
Tier 1 non sde roles are really few. U can check the sheet for the exact number
Bro are you from rr or electronic city

Hey, had a doubt... for most of the SDE roles...in the coding round we need to know DSA, DBMS, OS, CN and in the interview they will question us on DSA and on the projects we have made on web dev or any other CS related project.. am i right?
